pull_request.title: Pose frame semantics: proposal for new behavior

pullrequest.title: Pose frame semantics: proposal for new behavior

content.raw:
I think this section understates the value this provides; parity with URDF isn’t the only value. I think it the underlying motivation is solely that it permits specifying things in relative frames, which is **HUGE** improvement in my eyes!

Sure, parity with URDF is a side effect of this, but I don’t think we should narrow the benefit to just saying that “hey, there’s more compatibility”. Rather, “hey, you can specify things physically”, which is much more intrinsic.

Rationale: I want URDF to be replaced by SDFormat at some point, if possible, and make that possible by minimizing / removing the pain points with SDFormat itself, and not say that we’re doing this to support sustained compatibility. \(I’m fine-ish with that happening, but would like to possibly steer away from that…\)
content.html:
I think this section understates the value this provides; parity with URDF isn’t the only value. I think it the underlying motivation is solely that it permits specifying things in relative frames, which is HUGE improvement in my eyes!

Sure, parity with URDF is a side effect of this, but I don’t think we should narrow the benefit to just saying that “hey, there’s more compatibility”. Rather, “hey, you can specify things physically”, which is much more intrinsic.

Rationale: I want URDF to be replaced by SDFormat at some point, if possible, and make that possible by minimizing / removing the pain points with SDFormat itself, and not say that we’re doing this to support sustained compatibility. (I’m fine-ish with that happening, but would like to possibly steer away from that…)

content.raw:
May want to discuss more on the semantics of what frames can be used;

e.g. it'd be good if we didn't permit attaching a `<visual>` of a moving `<link>` to the `<world>` frame \(or another `<link>` frame\).
content.html:
May want to discuss more on the semantics of what frames can be used;

e.g. it'd be good if we didn't permit attaching a <visual> of a moving <link> to the <world> frame (or another <link> frame).

content.raw:
Per f2f, we may want to explicitly decouple unique names from implicit frames.

“… may not imply that all elements have implicit frames…”

Will be coupled to what elements can define child frames.
content.html:
Per f2f, we may want to explicitly decouple unique names from implicit frames.

“… may not imply that all elements have implicit frames…”

Will be coupled to what elements can define child frames.

pullrequest.title: Pose frame semantics: proposal for new behavior

content.raw:
Per f2f: Would be nice to try and make frame specification more physical, maybe not make all element poses \(e.g. visual / collision / sensor\) with implicit frames; rather, than use explicit frames.

Trade-off with usage \+ ease of use – vs – frame “pollution”; also topological concerns.
content.html:
Per f2f: Would be nice to try and make frame specification more physical, maybe not make all element poses (e.g. visual / collision / sensor) with implicit frames; rather, than use explicit frames.

Trade-off with usage + ease of use – vs – frame “pollution”; also topological concerns.
